lines.text: Here’s where they keep the spellbooks.
There’s only two important ones here- a book on <c=#FF6000>Go Magic,</c> and a book on <c=#0000FF>Stop Magic.</c>
(Which spellbook should I check out?)
Hey hey hey! Here's where the goods are at!
Huh?
Spellbooks! All that sweet good knowledge!
Hrmph. This ain't a candy store, wiz kid. You're here to investigate a crime, not load up on illegal magic.
Hey, now, you don't trust me? I swear, I'll just keep to the stuff that's relevant to the case.
You better, Seeker.
So, let's see...
...Oh. It's trash.
Trash?
Yeah, it's all 101 stuff. I already know most of this junk, except for all this class-specific stuff.
What do you mean 'class-specific?'
Like, there's two big books here- spellbooks for Go Wizardry, and Stop Wizardry. Those spells only work if you're a certain type of wizard.
That's what I figured. You guys come in <c=#FF00FF>types,</c> right?
I mean, not usually. If you take a 'class', you sacrifice all your other magic so you can use spells from a list of class-restricted stuff.
So, it's pretty good if the dead guy here is one of these types- it means there's only so many spells he could have used here.
Narrows down what we have to worry about, huh?
Bleh. Yeah, but it's worthless to me.
Let's see...
(Which spellbook should I check out first?)
Huh, this is, uh... kind of an introductory text. Not much high-level stuff here.
We've got Living Memory, a level one spell.
Projects a static image of a specific moment in time, according to how you remembered it.
Looks like it's got a duration of two hours.
Then there's Mass Arrest Momentum. This one's level one, too.
One-two?
T-O-O. As in, it's also level one. Sheesh.
Anyway, this spell is sort of your basic freeze. Anything in the Stop Wizard's sights just sorta stops in time.
You can still see stuff and think, though- and you can break out if you're strong enough.
Strong enough?
Ah... you gotta pass a 'constitution saving throw.'
If you're beefy enough, or the Stop Wizard tried to freeze too much, or you're just lucky, bam! Spell over. Starts moving again.
Otherwise, it lasts until the Stop Wizard decides to end it.
Lastly, we got... Flesh to Stone. Yikes. This one's level two.
Level what too? Level one?
You're doing that on purpose. To mess with me.
I would never dream of such a thing.
Yeah. Sure.
Whatever. Flesh to Stone lets you turn someone or something into a statue. Pretty nasty stuff.
Looks like you can't use it if the target already has a <c=#FF00FF>status effect,</c> though.
If you try, the spell rebounds on you. Not fun.
Oh, and apparently you need some special tattoos to be a Stop Wizard.
That's about all this book's got. Give me a break! This is kid stuff!
(If I want to go over what I just learned, I should press A or D to remember it.)
...Man, what? This book is completely baby school! It's only got three low-level spells!
I guess let's check it out. First, we've got... <c=#FF6000>Portable Hole.</c>
This one's level one- it warps space a little, and makes holes through things without damaging them.
It can make holes up to two meters wide and four meters deep- pretty impressive for a beginner’s spell.
And... looks like it lasts until the caster gets more than six meters away from the hole, or until they end it.
What’s next? Uh… <c=#FF6000>Reversing Rune</c>, huh? This one’s pretty cool.
You draw this symbol on something- or stick a sticker with it on something- and if it’s moving, it turns around and goes backwards!
Like, stick it on a car, and suddenly it’s going against traffic! Or stick it on yourself if you’re falling, and fly into the air!
That one’s a level one spell, too. What else is there?
You’ve gotta be level two to cast this last one. It’s called <c=#FF6000>Emergency Exit.</c>
Some fancy fire magic, here- it lets you use fire as a portal to teleport through.
If you cast it, you’re immune to fire for thirty seconds, and you can pop over to any fire within two kilometers.
Two kilometers? Gah…
Hey! Widen the search perimeter! The perp might've had a 2km head start!
...That’s right! As many men as you need! Step on it!
On top of spells, there’s also some diagrams of tattoos you need to be a Go Wizard.
That’s it for Go Wizardry. Kind of a lame spellbook, TBH.
(If I want to go over what I just learned, I should press A or D to remember it.)
Eh... y'know, I'm gonna check out something else first.
Don't feel like buckling down and hitting the books just yet, y'know?
This book can teach a Stop Wizard <c=#0000FF>Living Memory</c>, <c=#0000FF>Mass Arrest Momentum</c>, and <c=#0000FF>Flesh to Stone</c>.
That should be all we have to worry about, with Stop Wizards.

That should be all we have to worry about, with Go Wizards.
